Ira furor brevis est. - 'Wrath is but a: Igitur qui desiderat pacem, praeparet bellum. - 'Therefore let him who desires peace get ready for war.'
Aliis si licet, tibi non licet. - 'To others it is permitted, to you it is not permitted'
Acta Non Verba. - 'Actions instead of words'
Semper Idem - 'Always the same.'
Male parta male dilabuntur - 'What has been wrongly gained is wrongly lost.'
Fortes fortuna adiuvat. - 'Luck is with the bravest.'
Omnes una manet nox - 'One night awaits everyone.'
Carpe diem. - 'Seize the day.'
Quis, Quid, Ubi, Quibus Auxiliis, Cur, Quomodo, Quando? - 'Who, what, where, with what, why, how, when?'
In vino veritas. - 'Truth lies in wine'
Exitus Acta Probat – ‘The result justifies the deed.’
Alea iacta est. - 'The die is cast.'
Veni, vidi, vici. - 'I came, I saw, I conquered.'
Memento mori. - 'Remember that you must die.'
Oderint dum metuant. - 'Let them hate, so long as they fear.'
Vae victis. - 'Woe to the vanquished.'
Dulce et decorum est pro patria mori. - 'It is sweet and fitting to die for one's country.'
Non ducor, duco. - 'I am not led, I lead.'
Panem et circenses. - 'Bread and circuses.'
Homo homini lupus est. - 'Man is wolf to man.'
Pecunia non olet. - 'Money does not stink.'
Repetitio est mater studiorum. - 'Repetition is the mother of learning.'
De omnibus dubitandum. - 'Be suspicious of everything.'
Ad astra per aspera. - 'Through hardship to the stars.'
Barba non facit philosophum. - 'A beard does not make a philosopher.'
Draco dormiens nunquam titillandus. - 'Never tickle a sleeping dragon.'
Festina lente. - 'Make haste slowly.'
Audere est Facere. - 'To dare is to do.'
In absentia lucis, lupi vivunt. - 'In the absence of light, wolves live.'
